story.storykicker: G5 will compete with the likes of the Galaxy S7 and the iPhone 6S, and has a couple of unique features that help it stand out in the crowded phone market.
story.storybody:
LG on Wednesday launched its flagship Android phone G5 in India. The phone, which will compete with the likes of the Galaxy S7 and the iPhone 6S, has a couple of unique features that help it stand out in the crowded phone market. The phone will be sold in India at a price of Rs 52,990.

Just like other high-end phones like the HTC 10 and the Galaxy S7, the G5 has powerful hardware inside it. It is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 820 and has 4GB RAM. It also has 32GB internal storage and a shell made of aluminium.

Also Read: LG G5 to be sold in India for Rs 52,990, pre-booking starts

However, beyond the usual hardware, the G5 comes with several unique features. It has two cameras on the back. One of these cameras -- the 16-megapixel one -- is the regular camera. But the other one -- an 8-megapixel one on the front -- has a very wide field of view. The idea is that when consumers are clicking regular images they will use the 16MP camera while for landscape and architecture they may find the 8-megapixel camera a better deal.

The G5 is also probably the first proper phone with a modular design. It has a battery module that can be taken out using a sliding mechanism. The same slot then can be used to attach several modular accessories, such as the B&O audio player or a camera grip.

Also Read: LG G5 quick review: Something different, something playful

Earlier, LG had opened the pre-bookings for the phone. "The wait for the first ever modular phone of 2016 to arrive in India is now over. Customers can now pre-book the LG G5 and we hope more and more people will take advantage of this opportunity. The G5 is our most innovative smartphone till date and consumers would surely be awestruck on the most innovative modular concept of LG G5. We are very excited to bring LG G5 to India," Amit Gujral, marketing head, Mobiles, LG India had said.

Also Read: LG G5: Specs, features, and everything you need to know
story.magazinekicker: G5 will compete with the likes of the Galaxy S7 and the iPhone 6S, and has a couple of unique features that help it stand out in the crowded phone market.
story.shortheadline: LG G5 with 2 rear cams, Snapdragon 820 launched in India at Rs 52,990
